gravitate.controllers.grouping.grouping module¶

gravitate.controllers.grouping.grouping.drop_group(ids: set, orbit_id: str = None, event_id: str = None, location_id: str = None)[source]¶
gravitate.controllers.grouping.grouping.group_all_pairs_of_event(pair_list: list) → list[source]¶
Description (Experimental)

Groups all pairs of ride requests under an event

This function 1. reads all ride requests associated with an event 2. puts ride requests into groups 3. call join method on each grouping

Parameters:pair_list – a list of all pairs of ride requests under an event
Returns:a list of ride request ids not joined
gravitate.controllers.grouping.grouping.group_many(ride_request_ids: list)[source]¶

This function tries to match rideRequests into groups with grouping algorithms. Note that the rideRequests may be in different orbits, and rideRequests may not

be grouped into any orbit.
Parameters:ride_request_ids –
Returns:

Force matches two rideRequests into an orbit.

Parameters:ride_request_ids – Two rideRequest Ids

gravitate.controllers.grouping.orbit_group module¶

class gravitate.controllers.grouping.orbit_group.OrbitGroup(transaction)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class handles operations of grouping ride requests into orbits. Compared to Group, this new class has better atomicity.

(Experimental)

execute() → set[source]¶

This method puts rideRequests into orbit and update participants eventSchedule in atomic operations. :return: a list of rideRequests that are not joined
